001/*******************************************************************************

003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.
004 * Permission to use and distribute this software is granted under the BSD 2-Clause

007 * All rights reserved. Visit http://www.imagingbook.com for additional details.
008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.AlgebraicEllipse;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019public interface EllipseFitAlgebraic {
020        
021        public enum FitType {
022                FitzgibbonNaive,
023                FitzgibbonOriginal,
024                FitzgibbonStable,
025                Taubin1,
026                Taubin2
027        }
028        
029        public static EllipseFitAlgebraic getFit(FitType type, Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
030                switch (type) {
031                case FitzgibbonNaive:           return new EllipseFitFitzgibbonNaive(points);
032                case FitzgibbonOriginal:        return new EllipseFitFitzgibbonOriginal(points);
033                case FitzgibbonStable:          return new EllipseFitFitzgibbonStable(points, xref);
034                case Taubin1:                           return new EllipseFitTaubin1(points, xref);
035                case Taubin2:                           return new EllipseFitTaubin2(points, xref);
036                }
037                throw new RuntimeException("unknown algebraic fit type: " + type);
038        }
039        
040        /**
041         * Returns a vector of algebraic ellipse parameters:
042         * {@code (a,b,c,d,e,f)}, representing the ellipse by
043         * {@code a x^2 + b x y + c y^2 + d x + e y + f = 0}.
044         * @return the ellipse parameters
045         */
046        public double[] getParameters();
047        
048        /**
049         * Returns a algebraic ellipse constructed from the 
050         * estimated ellipse parameters.
051         * 
052         * @return an {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance
053         */
054        public default AlgebraicEllipse getEllipse() {
055                double[] p = getParameters();
056                return (p == null) ? null : new AlgebraicEllipse(p);
057        }
058        
059        public default boolean isEllipse() {
060                double[] p = getParameters();   // p = (a,b,c,d,e,f)
061                if (p == null) {
062                        return false;
063                }
064                else {
065                        double a = p[0];
066                        double b = p[1];
067                        double c = p[2];
068                        return (sqr(b) - 4*a*c) < 0;
069                }
070        }
071        
072        /**
073         * <p>
074         * Returns a 6x6 matrix (U) to convert ellipse parameters qr = (ar,...,fr)
075         * calculated for data centered at (xr, yr) to ellipse parameters q = (a,...,f)
076         * for the original non-centered data: q = U * qr. See [1, Sec. 11.2.1] (e.g.,
077         * Alg. 11.6) for additional information.
078         * </p>
079         * <p>
080         * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic
081         * Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
082         * </p>
083         * 
084         * @param xr data reference point (x)
085         * @param yr data reference point (y)
086         * @return the offset correction matrix (U)
087         */
088        public default RealMatrix getDataOffsetCorrectionMatrix(double xr, double yr) {
089                return Matrix.makeRealMatrix(6, 6,
090                                1,       0,     0,        0,   0,  0 ,
091                                0,       1,     0,        0,   0,  0 ,
092                                0,       0,     1,        0,   0,  0 ,
093                           -2*xr,   -yr,    0,        1,   0,  0 ,
094                                0,      -xr,   -2*yr,     0,   1,  0 ,
095                                sqr(xr), xr*yr, sqr(yr), -xr, -yr, 1 );
096        }
097        
098        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
099        
100        public static void main(String[] args) {
101                Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(31, 90);
102                Pnt2d p2 = Pnt2d.from(79, 25);
103                Pnt2d p3 = Pnt2d.from(159, 31);
104                Pnt2d p4 = Pnt2d.from(174, 55);
105                Pnt2d p5 = Pnt2d.from(173, 84);
106                Pnt2d p6 = Pnt2d.from(135, 114);
107                
108                Pnt2d[] pts = {p1, p2, p3, p4, p5, p6};
109                Pnt2d xr = Pnt2d.from(100,100);
110                
111                for (FitType type : FitType.values()) {
112                        EllipseFitAlgebraic fit = EllipseFitAlgebraic.getFit(type, pts, xr);
113                        System.out.println(type);
114                        if (fit != null) {
115                                System.out.println(fit.getEllipse());
116                        }
117                }
118                
119        }
120
121
122}
